sources.title: Rattlers
sources.description: This film has fallen into the Public Domain.

sources.title: Rattlers
sources.description: Title: Rattlers Summary: A herpetologist investigating a series of fatal rattlesnake attacks discovers that the creatures have been infected by a mysterious nerve gas disposed of in the desert by the military. Directed by: John McCauley Actors: Sam Chew Jr., Elisabeth Chauvet, Dan Priest Production Company: Boxoffice International Pictures (BIP) Release Date: 23 April 1976 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.85 : 1 A large number of chemically altered rattlesnakes become fearsome killers in this TV chiller. The tale is set in the Mojave Desert and centers upon Sam Parkinson, a noted herpetologist, who has come to investigate a series of strange deaths that began with two dead children found near their parents' campsites.

metadata.Plot: A large number of chemically altered rattlesnakes become fearsome killers in this TV chiller.
